subject: Personal Finance
title: Minimum Wage Debates
description: A short lesson to help you apply Minimum Wage Debates.

hook.text: The federal minimum wage is $7.25. Some cities set it at $15+. Economists can't agree who's right.

buildup.text: Minimum wage laws set a floor below which employers cannot legally pay workers.

discovery.text: Supporters say it lifts workers out of poverty. Critics say it kills jobs for the least skilled.

twist.text: Recent research suggests moderate minimum wage increases don't significantly reduce employment â€” challenging old theory.

climax.text: The real debate isn't whether minimum wage works, but how high it can go before downsides outweigh benefits.

punchline.text: The right minimum wage depends on the local economy.

quiz.question: What is the main argument against raising the minimum wage?
options: It may reduce employment for low-skilled workers
